topics.name: Exploring The World - Traveling and Excursions
Singles Who Love to Travel Travel

results.description:
I enjoy traveling, and although traveling alone is enjoyable, I find that it's much more exciting when traveling with others who enjoy exploring a variety of destinations. I am passionate about all types of travel, and destinations with beaches and great spas are my absolute fav!. In addition to travel I enjoy social events, philanthropy, networking, and mentoring. I thought it would be nice to meet others who enjoy all of these things as much as I do. As a result, I created this Travel and Social Meet Up Group. This Group is targeting the Professional Woman who is busy most days, and seeks Travel & Social Companions when it's time to have some fun, whether attending a social event, or seeing the world. 

All of our Vacations and Social Events are open to Adults Only (25+).

The Clique Travel and Social Alliance is not only about seeing the world and socializing.. it's about building long lasting friendships, empowering and uplifting each other to be the best that 'we' (as individuals) can be.. and making the most of this wonderful experience we call life.. ‪

Our Alliance attracts women who enjoy traveling, networking, socializing via gatherings, social events, cocktail parties, and giving back in the community. We plan a variety of social events and trips. Travel includes Spa Getaways, Wellness Retreats, International Excursions, and a host of other FUN, EXCITING, Travel & Social Options for those who like to go, but don't want to go SOLO. Our objective is to connect professional women who have a passion for networking, empowerment, and travel! Together we jet set to explore the beautiful world we live in. JOIN US!

This group consists of individuals with 'positive, respectful, fun-filled personalities. We want all events to be inviting and enjoyed by all participants.

A mandatory requirement to join this group is that you include a 'recent photo' of yourself on your profile (vs. an object, flower, animal, etc.). This helps members recognize each other at our events.

We look forward to having some memorable 'fun' and 'camaraderie' at each event!

Some of the destinations that we traveled to in 2015 included Las Vegas (Vegas Uncorked), and Saint Lucia (Saint Lucia Jazz Festival). Join us for 2016 travel excursions and social events.. 

[ #connect #empower #thrive ]℠ #jointheclique
results.name: The Clique Travel and Social Alliance℠ - NYC / NJ

results.description:
ZBRELLA Tech Talks & Training started as a way to train front line engineers and quickly turned into a meeting of people looking to learn more about Information Technology, Troubleshooting, Infrastructure systems and much more from people who have work with the technologies. 

 What the group is - we are a group of professionals that run a technology consulting company that decided to open up our weekly technology training sessions to anyone looking to get more hands on experience, looking to learn about managing networks, be around people and do more than just discuss new technologies. Think of the group as a technology training class that works with virtualizaiton, servers, workstations, security, encryption, scripting, management strategies, network configuration, cloud, SaaS, IOT and on and on. But we don't stop there because we also play with Raspberry Pi's by setting up tor routers or ssh servers, Amazon Echo's and trying to configure new skills on AWS micro-service servers, and on and on. We are here to share our knowledge and experience with people who want to learn, get hands on, love technology and have a good time. We would also like to learn from others. 

There is nothing technology related off limits as long as we can all learn and create a project to put our book knowledge to work. Come on down if you are interested and want to learn. Just so you are forewarned, it is not really a networking event but more of a classroom within our offices. Formats may change but the primary goal is to teach and learn.

Future Plans - in the near future we are looking to invite well known professionals and experts to come speak at our bi-weekly training events, have a fully functional lab to experiment in, purchase more raspberry pi's for projects, and build a fully functional streaming studio.
results.name: ZBRELLA Presents Tech Talks & Training

results.description:
Let me put this out there, this is not your regular startup meetup. This is not where you come in and exchange business cards and still get nowhere with your idea/business. This group is for the doers. A group like this is materialized by the idea that it is quite impossible to even find a UX guy, who could create few icons for a small mobile app we made by walking into all the tech meetups out there.

This group is for the people who have an idea and looking for a developer to code/do UI design, find a freelancer for few hours fix your website and for that developer who know everything about functionality, yet have no creativity even to make his simple app icon or a loading image gif and still needs to find someone to make it for him.

You belong here if you are

1. An entrepreneur, who brings that prototype he made

2. The next big idea, looking for couple of app developers to build it.

3. A Smartup guy looking for funding, bring data and POCs to get your funding from someone interested in it.

4. A developer made that awesome mobile app and would wanted investment for further development

5. A freelancer knows angularJS and willing to make few extra by fixing your new website made of poor js everywhere.

6. An smartApp maker, needs different icons for different version/devices so his app would look a lot nicer

7. An crowd sourced app maker, would like to market his app and write some charming app description on the app store and willing to pay someone who knows how to do it.

8. Students looking to learn to code by participating in tech ventures, startups or non-profits and ready for internships.

9.  May be to find a guy who knows C# and Xamarin to work with your next cross platform mobile app which will work in Android, iOS and Windows alike or a Java fella, to write your next healthcare app on android wear or the Angular js guy to create your bootstrap enable website and the like.

In short, this is for the hard core technical talents and those who are willing to trade for that talent.

Let's make some new tech*
results.name: New York Tech Factory(NYTF)

results.description:
The Hoboken & JC Vegan Activist Meetup group is organized by EARTH - Environmentalist Animal Rights Team of Hoboken.  Our goal is to increase awareness about the vegan lifestyle in order to protect animals and the environment.  We want to attract more people to the vegan lifestyle as well as inspire current vegans and the vegan-curious in the area to become active in the community and  participate in outreach events.  

Are you frustrated that there aren't any vegan restaurants in the Hoboken/Jersey City area?  Would you like to see more vegan options?  Do you want to take action and educate others about veganism, but don't know where to start?  Do you want to socialize with other vegans? Or are you not vegan (yet!) but curious to learn more about the lifestyle?  You are in the right place.

We will organize social events at vegan-friendly restaurants in order to show businesses there is a growing demand for vegan food (and to socialize of course), as well as leafleting and chalking events to spread awareness.  And we will host some other fun events such as animal sanctuary visits, potlucks, and community food sampling/lectures as we go along!

This group is open to vegans, vegetarians, and the veg-curious who want to connect with other like-minded individuals and take action to help animals and the environment. We do ask that those who attend our social events order only vegan food.

For more information about EARTH and our events "Like" our Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/EnvironmentalistAnimalRightsTeamofHoboken
results.name: Hoboken & JC Vegan Activist Meetup

results.description: Find Your Voice is a different singing meet up, one that hopefully meets the needs of those individuals who want a chance to sing in front of a very small group of peers to get feedback on their voice and how they sounded with their song choice. This is a meetup for those who feel that they have real singing talent and want the feedback of caring people who want to help one another. This meetup is going to be set up for a limited size group (5 people max per Meetup- want each person to really have a chance to sing and get feedback) that must be willing to commit to showing up and paying for their seat in a private karaoke room in midtown manhattan. If you do not want to pay for your spot or are just looking for a group to socialize with, there are other karaoke meetups that are much better suited for you, please check those out instead. This meetup will be dedicated to practicing, and will be a lot of fun for those who put effort into it. Please only request to join if you really want to practice singing and get feedback from your peers. This meetup is meant to be a nurturing, comfortable place for those who want to test their vocal range through their song choices, so no photos or videos will be allowed during the meetup. As mentioned, this meetup will occur in a private karaoke room; access to the room is charged per person, per hour. I will get specifics on how much each attendee will have to pay on the RSVP. The Meetup will be limited to 5 people in total (no guests allowed), so once the RSVP is open, it is first come, first served. All cancellations to an RSVP must occur 24 hours BEFORE the event because we are committing to bringing a certain number of people to in order to reserve the room. I need to be sure that everyone who RSVPs will show up to ensure we do not lose the room to a larger group (or worse, have to collectively pay for the empty seat) because we are suddenly short on people for the reservation. Thanks.
results.name: Find Your Voice

results.description:
We welcome you to the BWN sisterhood. At BWN we are making a difference one woman/child at a time. 

The mission of BWN (Black Women Networking) is to Unite, Edify, and Empower as we connect women from various professions, business backgrounds, and cultures. 

The purpose of connecting and building this uniquely designed Organization is to mutually benefit each other in creating a community of like-minded women of color, to be the very best at what we do, and as a result change the negative images portrayed in Society of us. 

BWN opens opportunities to grow and stand out in a crowd, but most of all, to have a voice that can be heard around the Globe. BWN’s overall mission is to provide resources for women and children abroad to succeed in life as a whole person on different levels, and catapult them into a destiny designed for greatness.

B.W.N., now at a National level, with presence in 20 Top major Cities in the U.S., will be moving progressively into an International Organization. 

We will achieve this goal through seminars, retreats, conferences, books, broadcastings, radio and tele conference calls, to name a few. 

B.W.N. will offer mentorship, training, and coaching to all women and kids of color using these resources to have a promising future in avenues beyond their current reach. 

We develop: Business Owners, Speakers, Authors – through Networking, Outreach, and Training.




* What your Meetup Group is about
* Who should join: Describe your ideal members
* Why they should join: To learn, share, or have fun
* What members can expect: Describe typical activities
results.name: Black Women Networking (BWN) NJ

Our purpose is to bring creativity, joy and awareness into people’s lives; to assist in building happier and healthier families, businesses and communities.
Our passion is to help individuals, families and communities to better understand their own unique values and beauty, to appreciate it and to find a way to bring it out, share with others, and manifest in the society.
We are happy to offer our knowledge and wisdom, inherited and earned during many years of trainings to the service of others in order to create more harmony in our beloved planet – Mother TERRA.
More info at TERRApia.org

results.description:
A meet-up dedicated to the proposition that all fathers are created equal--some just become more equal than others.

This is an attempt to bring into the light of day those shy, scruff-faced creatures people read about in the pages of Esquire, The New York Times, Brooklyn Magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Huffington Post, and GQ: the real stay-at-home fathers of Brooklyn, ex- and current hipsters, entrepreneurs, urban farmers, writers, artists, cheesemakers, musicians, graphic designers, old-timey shoppe owners, burnt-out chefs, poured-dry bartenders, rogue traders and whistleblowers who’ll never work on Wall Street again, tattoo artists, corporate refugees waiting out non-competes, beard-and-moustache stylists, failed mimes, lovers of children all, and all are welcome...

We're looking for some good men* to bring forth their daughters and sons on a regular or semi-regular basis, toss the kids into a big pile at a playground, go on hikes or picnics at the various borough parks, visit cool exhibits at museums around the city, take them out to see music—to take advantage of all the city has to offer a man** and his children. Especially the free stuff.

And if we sometimes end up at a bar enjoying a beer and a bourbon with our babes in arms (not actually sharing the drinks with the kids, nor hanging at a bar with our arms around “babes,” let's just be clear), well then, so be it. It is New York Fucking City, after all. 

And this is Brooklyn, first of all. 


*Moms welcome too, of course. And really, we welcome all dads--stay-at-home, work-from-home, sometimes-home.

**Or woman. Of course.
results.name: The Real Stay-at-Home Dads of Brooklyn
